SEARCH
Package entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
entity.Character
entity.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Killable
public class Player extends Character
Represents a Player character in the game. The Player has various attributes and abilities such as health points, experience points, inventory management, attack capabilities, and movement actions. This class extends Character and implements additional features.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Constructs a new Player instance with the specified position, size, and default attributes.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the player's initial position
      y - the y-coordinate of the player's initial position
      width - the width of the player
      height - the height of the player

  • Method Details

    • attack

      public void attack(Character target)
      Executes an attack action against a specified target character. The method checks if the target is within the attack hitbox. If a weapon is equipped, it uses the weapon's attack functionality; otherwise, it directly applies damage to the target's health. Finally, resets the attacking state.
      Overrides:
      attack in class Character
      Parameters:
      target - the character being targeted by the player's attack. Must be a valid instance of a Character.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Handles the damage taken by the player. Reduces damage based on equipped armor protection and applies any remaining damage to the player's health. If no health remains, calls death logic. Also sets invulnerability frames to prevent immediate subsequent damage.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in class Character
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of damage inflicted on the player. Must be a positive integer.

    • heal

      public void heal(int amount)
      Increases the player's health points by amount, up to the maximum allowed value.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of health points to be restored. Must be a valid positive integer.

    • getKilled

      public void getKilled()
      Handles the player's death logic by setting their health points to zero, marking their state as dead, and reducing their experience points by 10. Overrides the Killable.getKilled() method.

    • update

      public void update(Level level)
      Updates the player's state during each game tick. This includes updating cooldowns, the player's position within the level, and the position of the attack hitbox.
      Parameters:
      level - the current level context used for updating the player's position and interactions with the environment.

    • updateCooldowns

      protected void updateCooldowns()
      Updates the player's cooldown states, specifically related to their invulnerability frames.

    • jump

      public void jump(boolean jumpPressed)
      Handles the jump action for the player. Updates the player's vertical velocity and on-ground state based on whether the jump button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      jumpPressed - a boolean indicating whether the jump button is pressed. If true and the player is on the ground, the player will jump.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(float x, float y, Level level)
      Sets the position of the player to the specified x and y coordinates within the level. Updates the player's hitbox if it exists and resets vertical velocity and ground state.
      Parameters:
      x - the new x-coordinate for the player.
      y - the new y-coordinate for the player.
      level - the level context in which the player's position is being set.

    • dropSelectedItem

      public void dropSelectedItem(ItemHandler itemHandler)
      Drops the currently selected item from the player's inventory and places it at the player's current position in the game world. If the dropped item is a weapon, the player's currently equipped weapon is set to null. The item is then added to the game map through the provided ItemHandler.
      Parameters:
      itemHandler - the ItemHandler instance responsible for managing and adding items to the game map.

    • getInventory

      public Inventory getInventory()

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()

    • gainXP

      public void gainXP(int xp)
      Adds experience points (XP) to the player. The XP is accumulated up to a maximum cap of 400. The method ensures that the player's XP remains within the range of 0 to 400. If the XP reaches exactly 400, the player upgrades.
      Parameters:
      xp - the amount of experience points to be added to the player. Must be a valid integer. Negative values will not decrease the player's XP below 0.

    • getXp

      public int getXp()

    • setDead

      public void setDead(boolean dead)

    • readyToTakeDamage

      public boolean readyToTakeDamage()
      Determines if the player is ready to take damage. This is based on whether the player has remaining invulnerability frames.
      Returns:
      true if the player has no invulnerability frames left (and is ready to take damage), false otherwise.

    • setXp

      public void setXp(int xp)

    • getInvulnerabilityFrames

      public int getInvulnerabilityFrames()

    • setInvulnerabilityFrames

      public void setInvulnerabilityFrames(int invulnerabilityFrames)
